Name: Funerary Panel with a Dove
Description: The oblong stela, an upright stone with a sculpted surface, is topped by a cross enclosed within a laurel crown, which is the symbol of the Byzantine Empire. Beneath it is a dove facing forward. The bird's body is made by dotting and the wings are depicted with ridges and dots. The lower part of the panel has undergone restoration. Doves are Christian symbols for the Holy Spirit.
